content.description: Tunnel Vision ascends a solid slab on very small and shallow two finger pockets. Cool holds and a good challenge. Worth seeking out.
content.protection: A pad or two and a Spotter
content.location: This problem is in an alcove on the West rim around the back of Squeeze Job and Bigs Cafe. Look for a large birds nest in  a high pocket. The climb is to the left in a slot.

content.description:
The first move after pulling off the ground might take some heart. Move up to a series of extremely small but positive crimps, including one that might be the most perfect crimp at the Happy Boulders.

I would appreciate feedback on the grade. Thanks!

vimeo.com/82058457
content.protection: A pad or two and a spotter. Some skin and a bit of heart.
content.location: Located on the boulder just down canyon of the main Cleopatra Area.

content.description: Climb the globe-shaped face left of Cleopatra

A blunt arete that starts with a high left hand and a small crimp for the right. DO NOT PULL ON THE UNDERCLING! Hug the arete and heel hook, maybe. Cool bump moves, a long reach to a mono, a sketchy top-out. Go finish it.

It is unclimbed and the grade is not confirmed. I would love someone to go get it done. Please feel free to change the name and let me know the grade.
content.location: In a corner. You can see this climb in the distance up and across the canyon from Slight Inducement.

content.description:
Start with the right hand high in an uncomfortable shallow pocket and the left low on a crimp. Go up with heel hooks and perhaps hip flexibility.

A very friable and dirty sit start was attempted but the holds broke.
content.location: To the left of  the "Tin Man" face.

content.description: Climb the right hand side of the face that is to the left of Cleopatra on somewhat awkward moves at first. Work up the face and make a reach/jump to a good jug covered in lichen. Rock over and out. Pretty damn fun and not as easy as it looks.

Sit start with your right hand on the deep sidepull (optional thumb-catch) and left hand in some of the little pockets.

Cross up right to the edge, match hands and switch feet. Then pull across to the left two-finger gaston and go for the left pinch line that leads to the top. Should feel a bit like Birthday Direct in the Buttermilks.

Top needs lots of brushing.
content.location: On the boulder to the right of Cleopatra, facing directly at the trail and Top Gun area.

content.description: Climb the left side of the face that is left of Cleopatra. Starting up the face and gain the crack and ride it out. Or go right onto  The Sphinx.
content.location: On the left side of the face that is left of Cleopatra.

content.description: This striking prow is found on the West Rim directly across the canyon from the Top Gun area. Look for a triangular wall with an orb on top. Cleopatra is just right of this. Start with good pockets and go directly up the rounded corner using left hand side pulls, and more pockets and then left to the top. Classic moves and very clean. A sit start looks possible.
content.protection: Take a bunch of pads and a few spotters. The falls are clean at the crux.
content.location: Hike up canyon to the Top Gun area. Look to the left side of the canyon,  make your way up and left to the base of the problem.

content.description: A tall wall that starts with some really hard, awkward moves above a roof and follows  some side pulls and small holds to the top. It has been rappelled and cleaned (mostly) last year, I also built a platform for pads. It is unclimbed and the grade is not confirmed. I would love someone to go get it done. Please feel free to change the name and let me know the grade. This could be pretty hard.
content.location: A large wall that is seen from the trail before the canyon turns to the left. Seen from the trail after you pass Slight Inducement across the canyon and westward.
